code: useShinyalert(), observeEvent(req(rv.filter$dataIn, rv.filter$i ), {     a <- (length(rv.filter$dataIn) != rv.filter$i) && !r.nav$isDone[length(r.nav$isDone)]     if (!a) return(NULL)      shinyalert(       title = 'title',       text = "This is a modal",       size = "xs",        closeOnEsc = TRUE,       closeOnClickOutside = FALSE,       html = FALSE,       type = "info",       showConfirmButton = TRUE,       showCancelButton = TRUE,       confirmButtonText = "OK",       confirmButtonCol = "#15A4E6",       cancelButtonText = "Cancel",       timer = 0,       imageUrl = "",       animation = FALSE     )   })    observe({     input$shinyalert     rv.filter$i     if(is.null(input$shinyalert))return(NULL)          c1 <- input$shinyalert     c2 <- rv.filter$i == length(rv.filter$dataIn)     c3 <- r.nav$isDone[length(r.nav$isDone)]     if (c1 && !c2 && !c3){       #Delete all assays after that one indicated by the indice given in parameter       rv.filter$dataIn <- rv.filter$dataIn[ , , -((rv.filter$i+1):length(rv.filter$dataIn))]       c1 <- input$shinyalert       c2 <- rv.filter$i == length(rv.filter$dataIn)       c3 <- r.nav$isDone[length(r.nav$isDone)]     } else {       # Do nothing, the module interface is still disabled     }     shinyjs::toggleState('div_nav_pipe_process', condition = !c3 && (c1||c2))   })

title: Prostar2
text: DAPAR Prostar package series software dedicated processing proteomics data. precisely, devoted analysis quantitative datasets produced bottom-discovery proteomics experiments LC-MS/MS pipeline (Liquid Chromatography Tandem Mass spectrometry). DAPAR (Differential Analysis Protein Abundance R) R package contains necessary functions process data command lines. can used ; complement numerous Bioconductor packages () compliant ; Prostar interface. Prostar (Proteomics statistical analysis R) web interface based Shiny technology () provides GUI (Graphical User Interfaces) DAPAR functionalities, guide practitioner comfortable R programming complete quantitative analysis process. experiment package DAPARdata contains many datasets can used examples. Prostar functionalities make possible easily: Manage quantitative datasets , quantitative dataset denotes table analyte (either peptide protein) represented line replicate (sample) represented column; cell table contains abundance given analyte given replicate; replicates clustered different conditions (groups). includes import/export, conversion report generation functionalities. Perform complete data processing chain: () filtering data cleaning; (ii) cross-replicate normalization; (iii) missing value imputation; (iv) aggregation peptide intensities protein intensities (optional); (v) null hypothesis significance testing. Mine dataset step processing chain various tools : () descriptive statistics; (ii) differential analysis; (iii) Gene Ontology (GO) analysis.

text: #' Plots interactive volcanoplot differential analysis. Typically, log Fold Change represented X-axis log10 p-value drawn Y-axis. th_pval th_logfc set, two lines drawn respectively y-axis X-axis visually distinguish differential non differential data. use package Highcharter, customizable tooltip appears user put mouse's pointer point scatter plot.

title: Volcanoplot of the differential analysis — diffAnaVolcanoplot_rCharts
text: df dataframe contains following slots : x : vector log(fold change) values differential analysis, y : vector p-value values returned differential analysis. index : vector rowanmes data. dataframe must built option stringsAsFactors set FALSE. may additional slots used show informations tooltip. name slots must begin prefix "tooltip_". automatically removed plot. th_pval floating number represents p-value separates differential non-differential data. th_logfc floating number represents log Fold Change separates differential non-differential data. conditions list names condition 1 2 used differential analysis. clickFunction string contains JavaScript function used show info slots df. variable .index refers slot named index allows retrieve right row show tooltip. pal xxx

title: Volcanoplot of the differential analysis — diffAnaVolcanoplot_rCharts
text: interactive volcanoplot

title: Volcanoplot of the differential analysis — diffAnaVolcanoplot_rCharts
text: Samuel Wieczorek

title: Volcanoplot of the differential analysis — diffAnaVolcanoplot_rCharts
code: if (interactive()){ library(highcharter) library(DaparToolshed) library(SummarizedExperiment) data(Exp1_R25_prot, package = "DaparToolshedData") obj <- Exp1_R25_prot # Simulate imputation of missing values obj <- DaparToolshed::NAIsZero(obj, 1) obj <- DaparToolshed::NAIsZero(obj, 2) qData <- as.matrix(SummarizedExperiment::assay(obj[[2]])) sTab <- colData(obj[[2]]) limma <- limmaCompleteTest(qData, sTab)  df <- data.frame(   x = limma$logFC[["25fmol_vs_10fmol_logFC"]],   y = -log10(limma$P_Value[["25fmol_vs_10fmol_pval"]]),   index = as.character(rownames(obj[[2]])) ) colnames(df) <- c("x", "y", "index") tooltipSlot <- c("Fasta_headers", "Sequence_length") df <- cbind(df, colData(obj[[2]])[, tooltipSlot]) colnames(df) <- gsub(".", "_", colnames(df), fixed = TRUE) if (ncol(df) > 3) {   colnames(df)[seq.int(from = 4, to = ncol(df))] <-     paste("tooltip_", colnames(df)[seq.int(from = 4, to = ncol(df))],       sep = ""     ) } hc_clickFunction <- JS("function(event) { Shiny.onInputChange('eventPointClicked', [this.index]+'_'+ [this.series.name]);}") cond <- c("25fmol", "10fmol") diffAnaVolcanoplot_rCharts(   df,   th_pval = 2.5,   th_logfc = 1,   conditions = cond,   clickFunction = hc_clickFunction ) }

title: popover_for_help_ui and popover_for_help_server — volcanoplot
code: if (interactive()){ library(highcharter) library(DaparToolshed) library(SummarizedExperiment) data(Exp1_R25_prot, package = "DaparToolshedData") obj <- Exp1_R25_prot # Simulate imputation of missing values obj <- DaparToolshed::NAIsZero(obj, 1) obj <- DaparToolshed::NAIsZero(obj, 2) qData <- as.matrix(SummarizedExperiment::assay(obj[[2]])) sTab <- colData(obj) limma <- limmaCompleteTest(qData, sTab)  df <- data.frame(   x = limma$logFC[["25fmol_vs_10fmol_logFC"]],   y = -log10(limma$P_Value[["25fmol_vs_10fmol_pval"]]),   index = as.character(rownames(obj[[2]])) ) colnames(df) <- c("x", "y", "index") tooltipSlot <- c("Fasta_headers", "Sequence_length") df <- cbind(df, colData(obj[[2]])[, tooltipSlot]) colnames(df) <- gsub(".", "_", colnames(df), fixed = TRUE) if (ncol(df) > 3) {   colnames(df)[seq.int(from = 4, to = ncol(df))] <-     paste("tooltip_", colnames(df)[seq.int(from = 4, to = ncol(df))],       sep = ""     ) } hc_clickFunction <- JS("function(event) { Shiny.onInputChange('eventPointClicked', [this.index]+'_'+ [this.series.name]);}") cond <- c("25fmol", "10fmol") diffAnaVolcanoplot_rCharts(   df,   th_pval = 2.5,   th_logfc = 1,   conditions = cond,   clickFunction = hc_clickFunction ) shiny::runApp(volcanoplot(xxxx)) }
